comment.text: This translation key is used for the title of a modal dialog that prompts the user to stop filling a form field. It appears on the header of the dialog and is displayed when the "Stop Filling" button is clicked or visible in certain contexts.

usage.context:
visible={visible}
 displayType={ModalDialogType.modal}
 onClose={onClose}
 data-testid="stop-filling-dialog"
 >
 <ModalDialog.Header>{t("Common:StopFillingTitle")}</ModalDialog.Header>
 <ModalDialog.Body>{t("Common:StopFillingBody")}</ModalDialog.Body>
 <ModalDialog.Footer>
 <Button
 id="stop-filling-dialog_submit"
 key="OKButton"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Doldurmaq dayandırılsın?' is a literal translation and doesn't convey the intended meaning of 'Stop filling?' in a natural way. It sounds awkward and overly formal in Azerbaijani.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural translation would be 'Dayandırılsın?' or 'Doldurmağı dayandırılsın?' depending on the context and desired level of formality.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Mit dem Ausfüllen stoppen?" is grammatically correct but a more natural translation of "Stop filling?" would be "Ausfüllen beenden?" or "Ausfüllen abbrechen?". "Mit dem Ausfüllen stoppen?" sounds slightly awkward in German.

The Armenian translation "Դադարե՞լ լրացնելը" literally translates to 'To stop filling?' which doesn't quite capture the interrogative nature of "Stop filling?" which implies a question like 'Do you want to stop filling?' or 'Are you going to stop filling?'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider translating it as "Կդադարես լրացնելը" (Kdadares lracnelə) which means 'Will you stop filling?' or "Դադարեցնելո՞ւ" (Dadarecnelo՞) which means 'To stop filling?' but is less conversational.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Interrompere la compilazione?' is grammatically correct, it's a bit formal and literal. A more natural and user-friendly translation for 'Stop filling?' might be 'Smetti di compilare?' or 'Vuoi interrompere la compilazione?'

The Korean translation "작성을 중지하시겠습니까?" is overly formal for the English phrase "Stop filling?". While grammatically correct, it's a more polite and formal inquiry than the casual tone of the original.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more casual translation like "작성 중지할까요?" or "그만 채울까요?" depending on the specific context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Doriți să încetați completarea?" is too literal and formal for a simple question like "Stop filling?". It translates to "Do you want to stop the completion?"
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural and concise translation like "Vrei să te oprești?" or "Nu mai completezi?"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "නොපිරීම නවත්තන්නද?" while understandable, isn't the most natural way to translate "Stop filling?". It directly translates 'not filling' and 'stop'. A more natural phrasing would be something along the lines of 'හිරවන්න නවත්තන්නද?' or 'ඉටු ගන්න නවත්තන්නද?' depending on the context of 'filling'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'හිරවන්න නවත්තන්නද?' or 'ඉටු ගන්න නවත්තන්නද?' based on the context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Ustavi izpolnjevanje?' while technically correct, sounds overly formal and literal for the question 'Stop filling?'. A more natural and user-friendly translation would be preferable.

The translation 'Зауставите попуњавање?' is a literal translation of "Stop filling?" but could be more natural in Serbian. While technically correct, a more common phrasing would be something like 'Престаните са попуњавањем?' or 'Откажите попуњавање?'

The translation "Doldurma durdurulsun mu?" is overly formal and doesn't quite capture the casual tone of "Stop filling?". A more natural Turkish equivalent would be closer to "Doldurmayı bırakır mıyız?" or "Doldurmayı keser miyiz?"
The English "Stop filling?" is a very informal question. "是否停止填写？" is more formal and literal. A better translation would convey the informality of the original.
